is a large lake located on the south side of the Alps in

On the south side of the Alps, Lake Maggiore is the second largest lake in Italy. With a length of 68 km and a coastline of over 150 km the glacial Lake Maggiore stretches from the Swiss canton Ticino in the north into the two major Italian regions Piedmont and Lombardy. Since the climate is mild year-round, the area is filled with Mediterranean vegetation and exotic plants. Surrounded by beautiful lake shore towns and villages with lush botanical gardens, amazing islands and a backdrop of Swiss mountain peaks the Lake Maggiore has become a top tourist destination, mainly for central and northern Europe tourists.

value: - Large Swiss town on the northern part of Lake Maggiore, with casino and ferry to other towns on the lake.
Borromean Islands - are a group of three small stunningly beautiful islands and two islets located between Verbania to the north and Stresa to the south
Brissago Islands - two islands located in the Swiss part of Lake Maggiore close to Ronco sopra Ascona and Brissago.

The next bigger airports are in Lugano and in Milan. From the
most parts of the Lake Maggiore can be reached by public transport.

value: content=Is a service on call that links Malpensa Airport to the western part with stops in Arona - Meina - Solcio - Lesa - Belgirate - Stresa - Baveno - Feriolo - Fondotoce - Verbania Suna - Verbania Pallanza and Verbania Intra. Book within 11.00 am of the day before the departure, choosing from the fixed timetable.

Coming from the North, the trains through the Gotthard tunnel go to Bellinzona. Here you have to change for the onward journey. On the eastern shore of the Lake there is a constant railway line, while only Locarno and the villages south of Stresa have access to the railway on the west side.

value: content=The trains of S30 line from the airport of Milan-Malpensa Terminal 1 head for Bellinzona with stops on west of Lake Maggiore at Laveno - Caldè - Porto Valtravaglia - Luino (compulsory stop with personnel changes FS/SBB) - Colmegna - Maccagno - Pino-Tronzano - Ranzo-S.Abbondio - Gerra (Gambarogno) - S. Nazzaro - Magadino and to Bellinzona (TILO S30). Push the button for a stop.
